output_list.criticism: In the transfer function, there is a possibility of integer overflow. If the balance of the sender is less than the value to be transferred, the subtraction operation will underflow and the balanceOf[_to] will overflow.

In the transferFrom function, there is a possibility of integer overflow. If the balance of the sender is less than the value to be transferred, the subtraction operation will underflow and the balanceOf[_to] will overflow.
In the mintToken function, there is a possibility of integer overflow. If the balance of the target is less than the mintedAmount, the addition operation will overflow.

In the transfer function, there is a possibility of access control vulnerability. The function does not check if the sender has the right to transfer tokens. An attacker can call the transfer function with the frozenAccount[msg.sender] condition and transfer tokens without permission.

In the transferFrom function, there is a possibility of access control vulnerability. The function does not check if the sender has the right to transfer tokens. An attacker can call the transferFrom function with the frozenAccount[_from] condition and transfer tokens without permission.
